storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications about schedule change request status to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery on request submission
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has a verified email address on file
Notification service is operational and configured
Employee has default notification preferences enabled (email and in-app)
Employee has permission to submit schedule change requests

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in all required fields for the schedule change request (date, time, reason, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid input and display no validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button to submit the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming request submission and generates a unique request ID

steps.action: Check the employee's registered email inbox within 1 minute of submission
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received confirming submission with request ID, submission timestamp, and request details

steps.action: Navigate to the in-app notification center or bell icon in the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed confirming submission with request ID, submission timestamp, and request details

steps.action: Navigate to the employee profile and access the notification history section
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page displays successfully with list of all notifications

steps.action: Locate the submission notification in the notification history list
steps.expectedResult: Submission notification is listed with correct request ID, timestamp, status, and complete request details matching the submitted information

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the system with 'Submitted' status
Both email and in-app notifications are logged in notification history
Notification delivery timestamp is recorded in the system
Request is queued for manager review

testCases.title: Verify notification on approval and rejection
preconditions: Employee has submitted a schedule change request that is in 'Pending' status
Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials and approval permissions
Employee has default notification preferences enabled (email and in-app)
Notification service is operational
Employee's email address is verified and active

steps.action: Manager navigates to the pending schedule change requests queue
steps.expectedResult: List of pending requests is displayed including the employee's submitted request

steps.action: Manager selects the employee's schedule change request to review
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with options to Approve, Reject, or Request More Information

steps.action: Manager clicks 'Approve' button and adds optional approval comments
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation dialog for approval action

steps.action: Manager confirms the approval action
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message, request status changes to 'Approved', and timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Within 1 minute, check the employee's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received indicating approval with request ID, approval timestamp, manager name, and any comments

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and checks the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed indicating approval with request ID, approval timestamp, manager name, and any comments

steps.action: Manager navigates to another pending schedule change request from a different employee
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with action options

steps.action: Manager clicks 'Reject' button and enters mandatory rejection reason
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation dialog for rejection action

steps.action: Manager confirms the rejection action
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message, request status changes to 'Rejected', and timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Within 1 minute, check the affected employee's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received indicating rejection with request ID, rejection timestamp, manager name, and rejection reason

steps.action: Affected employee logs into the system and checks the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed indicating rejection with request ID, rejection timestamp, manager name, and rejection reason

postconditions: Approved request status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Rejected request status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
All notifications are logged in notification history for respective employees
Notification delivery timestamps are recorded
Approved schedule changes are reflected in the employee's schedule
Rejected requests remain accessible for employee reference

testCases.title: Ensure notification preferences are respected
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has default notification preferences enabled (both email and in-app)
Employee has access to notification preferences settings
Notification service is operational
Employee has at least one pending or active schedule change request

steps.action: Navigate to the employee profile or settings page
steps.expectedResult: Profile/settings page is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Click on 'Notification Preferences' or 'Notification Settings' option
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed showing current settings with toggles for email and in-app notifications

steps.action: Verify current notification preferences show both email and in-app notifications are enabled
steps.expectedResult: Both email and in-app notification toggles are in 'ON' or 'Enabled' state

steps.action: Toggle the email notification preference to 'OFF' or 'Disabled'
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle changes to disabled state while in-app notification remains enabled

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preferences have been updated

steps.action: Trigger a notification event by submitting a new schedule change request or having a manager update an existing request status
steps.expectedResult: Request is processed successfully and notification event is triggered

steps.action: Within 1 minute, check the employee's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received for the triggered event

steps.action: Navigate to the in-app notification center in the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed for the triggered event with all relevant details (request ID, status, timestamp)

steps.action: Navigate back to notification preferences and verify email notifications remain disabled
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle remains in 'OFF' state and in-app notification toggle remains in 'ON' state

steps.action: Check notification history in employee profile
steps.expectedResult: Notification history shows the in-app notification was delivered but no email notification was sent for the recent event

postconditions: Employee notification preferences are updated in the database with email disabled
System continues to send only in-app notifications for future events
Preference change is logged in the audit trail
No email notifications are queued or sent for this employee until preferences are changed again

storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to configure approval workflows for schedule changes to align with organizational policies

testCases.title: Verify administrator can create and save valid workflow configurations
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the system with valid admin credentials
Administrator has 'Administrator' role with workflow configuration permissions
Workflow configuration UI is accessible and operational
At least one existing workflow configuration exists in the system
Valid approver users and roles are defined in the system
Database connection is active and ApprovalWorkflowConfig table is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the administration portal or admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard is displayed with administrative menu options

steps.action: Click on 'Approval Workflow Settings' or 'Workflow Configuration' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration UI is displayed showing list of current workflow configurations with details (name, approvers, rules, status)

steps.action: Verify the UI displays options to create new workflow, edit existing workflows, and view workflow details
steps.expectedResult: UI shows 'Create New Workflow' button and action buttons (Edit, View, Delete) for each existing workflow

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: Workflow creation form is displayed with fields for workflow name, description, approval levels, approvers, and conditional rules

steps.action: Enter a unique workflow name (e.g., 'Department Manager Approval Workflow')
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name field accepts input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter workflow description (e.g., 'Two-level approval for schedule changes requiring department manager and HR approval')
steps.expectedResult: Description field accepts input without validation errors

steps.action: Add first approval level by clicking 'Add Approval Level' and select 'Department Manager' role as approver
steps.expectedResult: First approval level is added with Department Manager role displayed, showing level order as 1

steps.action: Add second approval level and select 'HR Manager' role as approver
steps.expectedResult: Second approval level is added with HR Manager role displayed, showing level order as 2

steps.action: Add conditional routing rule: 'If request duration > 5 days, require additional VP approval'
steps.expectedResult: Conditional rule is added and displayed in the rules section with condition and action clearly shown

steps.action: Click 'Validate Configuration' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the workflow configuration and displays success message: 'Workflow configuration is valid'

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the new workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming workflow has been saved, and new workflow appears in the workflow list with 'Active' status

steps.action: Wait for 5 minutes to allow configuration propagation
steps.expectedResult: Time elapses without system errors

steps.action: As an employee user, submit a new schedule change request that matches the workflow criteria
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request is submitted successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: As administrator, navigate to the submitted request details and verify approval workflow assignment
steps.expectedResult: Request shows the newly created workflow is assigned with approval routing to Department Manager as first approver

steps.action: Verify the approval chain displays both Department Manager and HR Manager in correct sequence
steps.expectedResult: Approval chain shows Level 1: Department Manager (Pending), Level 2: HR Manager (Awaiting Level 1)

postconditions: New workflow configuration is saved in ApprovalWorkflowConfig table
Workflow is marked as 'Active' and available for assignment
Configuration change is logged in audit trail with administrator username and timestamp
New schedule change requests automatically use the updated workflow
Existing pending requests continue using their originally assigned workflows

testCases.title: Ensure invalid workflow configurations are rejected
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the system with valid admin credentials
Administrator has 'Administrator' role with workflow configuration permissions
Workflow configuration UI is accessible and operational
System validation rules are active and configured
Database connection is active

steps.action: Navigate to the workflow configuration UI via admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration page is displayed with list of existing workflows

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: Workflow creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter workflow name 'Test Invalid Workflow - Missing Approvers' and description
steps.expectedResult: Name and description fields accept input

steps.action: Leave the approvers section empty without adding any approval levels
steps.expectedResult: Form displays with no approval levels configured

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the workflow without approvers
steps.expectedResult: System prevents save operation and displays error message: 'Workflow must have at least one approval level with a valid approver'

steps.action: Verify the workflow was not saved by checking the workflow list
steps.expectedResult: New workflow does not appear in the workflow configuration list

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' button again to test circular rule scenario
steps.expectedResult: New workflow creation form is displayed

steps.action: Enter workflow name 'Test Circular Rule Workflow' and add Department Manager as Level 1 approver
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name is entered and Level 1 approver is configured

steps.action: Add conditional rule: 'If Department Manager rejects, route back to Department Manager for re-approval'
steps.expectedResult: Conditional rule is entered in the rules section

steps.action: Click 'Validate Configuration' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects circular routing logic and displays error message: 'Circular approval routing detected. Approver cannot route back to themselves.'

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the workflow with circular rule
steps.expectedResult: System prevents save operation and displays error message: 'Cannot save workflow with validation errors. Please fix circular routing rule.'

steps.action: Verify the workflow was not saved by checking the workflow list
steps.expectedResult: Circular rule workflow does not appear in the workflow configuration list

steps.action: Attempt to create workflow with duplicate name of an existing workflow
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message: 'Workflow name already exists. Please use a unique name.'

steps.action: Attempt to create workflow with special characters or SQL injection patterns in the name field
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message: 'Invalid characters detected. Workflow name can only contain alphanumeric characters, spaces, and hyphens.'

postconditions: No invalid workflow configurations are saved in the database
System maintains data integrity by rejecting malformed configurations
Error messages are logged for audit purposes
Existing valid workflows remain unaffected
Administrator remains on the configuration page to correct errors

testCases.title: Verify access control for workflow configuration features
preconditions: Non-administrator user account exists with 'Employee' or 'Manager' role (not Administrator role)
Non-administrator user has valid login credentials
Workflow configuration feature is protected by role-based access control
Administrator role is properly configured in the system
Authentication and authorization services are operational

steps.action: Log into the system using non-administrator user credentials (Employee or Manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is redirected to their role-appropriate dashboard

steps.action: Verify the main navigation menu or dashboard for presence of admin options
steps.expectedResult: Administration menu, admin dashboard link, or workflow configuration options are not visible in the navigation

steps.action: Attempt to manually navigate to workflow configuration URL by entering '/admin/workflow-configuration' or similar path in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error message: 'Access Denied. You do not have permission to access this resource.' or redirects to unauthorized page (403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify the user remains on an error page or is redirected to their appropriate dashboard
steps.expectedResult: User is not able to access workflow configuration UI and sees appropriate error message or is redirected

steps.action: Attempt to access workflow configuration API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client (GET /api/workflows)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message: 'Insufficient permissions. Administrator role required.'

steps.action: Attempt to create a workflow using API endpoint (POST /api/workflows) with non-admin credentials
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message: 'Insufficient permissions. Administrator role required.'

steps.action: Log out the non-administrator user
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in using administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs in and is redirected to admin dashboard

steps.action: Verify administration menu and workflow configuration options are visible
steps.expectedResult: Admin navigation menu displays with 'Workflow Configuration' or 'Approval Workflow Settings' option visible

steps.action: Navigate to workflow configuration UI
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration page loads successfully with full access to view, create, edit, and delete workflows

steps.action: Verify access is logged by checking audit trail or access logs
steps.expectedResult: System logs show denied access attempts by non-administrator user with timestamp and user ID

postconditions: Non-administrator users cannot access workflow configuration features
Administrator users retain full access to workflow configuration
All unauthorized access attempts are logged in audit trail
System security and role-based access control remain intact
No unauthorized changes are made to workflow configurations

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to generate reports on schedule change approvals to monitor workflow efficiency

testCases.title: Validate report generation with filters
preconditions: Manager user is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has role-based access to the reporting module
Approval workflow data exists in the system (ApprovalActions and ScheduleChangeRequests tables)
At least one department with approval data is available
Date range contains approval records for testing

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully and displays available report types

steps.action: Select 'Approval Workflow Report' from the report type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Filter options for date range and department are displayed

steps.action: Select a start date and end date for the report (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is accepted and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Select one or more departments from the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected departments are displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report generation begins and a loading indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for report generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displays filtered data including approval times, volumes, and outcomes for the selected date range and departments

steps.action: Review the report data table for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Report displays correct data matching the applied filters with columns for request ID, department, submission date, approval time, status, and outcome

steps.action: Scroll down to view visualizations section
steps.expectedResult: Visualizations section is visible with charts for approval times and volumes

steps.action: Examine the approval times visualization (e.g., bar chart or line graph)
steps.expectedResult: Visualization accurately reflects the approval time data from the report, showing time metrics by department or date

steps.action: Examine the approval volumes visualization (e.g., pie chart or bar chart)
steps.expectedResult: Visualization accurately reflects the approval volume data from the report, showing counts by status or department

steps.action: Verify that visualization data matches the tabular report data
steps.expectedResult: All numbers and metrics in visualizations correspond exactly to the data shown in the report table

postconditions: Report remains displayed on screen for further actions
Filter selections are retained for potential report modifications
Report data is cached for export functionality
System logs the report generation activity

testCases.title: Verify report export functionality
preconditions: Manager user is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has successfully generated an approval workflow report
Report is currently displayed on screen with data
Browser allows file downloads
System has export functionality enabled for CSV and PDF formats

steps.action: Locate the export options section on the generated report page
steps.expectedResult: Export section is visible with options for CSV and PDF formats

steps.action: Click the 'Export as CSV' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download begins immediately and browser shows download progress

steps.action: Wait for CSV download to complete and locate the downloaded file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is successfully downloaded to the default downloads folder with a descriptive filename (e.g., 'Approval_Workflow_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.csv')

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file in a spreadsheet application (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets)
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and displays all report data in proper columns

steps.action: Verify CSV content includes all data fields: request ID, department, dates, approval times, status, and outcomes
steps.expectedResult: All data fields are present and values match the report displayed on screen

steps.action: Verify CSV formatting is correct with proper delimiters and no data corruption
steps.expectedResult: Data is properly formatted with comma delimiters, headers in first row, and all special characters are correctly encoded

steps.action: Return to the report page in the browser
steps.expectedResult: Report page is still displayed with the same data

steps.action: Click the 'Export as PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download begins immediately and browser shows download progress

steps.action: Wait for PDF download to complete and locate the downloaded file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is successfully downloaded to the default downloads folder with a descriptive filename (e.g., 'Approval_Workflow_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf')

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file in a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays the report with proper formatting

steps.action: Verify PDF content includes report title, filter parameters, data table, and visualizations
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all report elements including header with filters applied, complete data table, and chart visualizations

steps.action: Verify PDF data accuracy by comparing values to the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: All data values in the PDF match exactly with the report displayed on screen

steps.action: Check PDF formatting for readability including page breaks, headers, and footers
steps.expectedResult: PDF is professionally formatted with proper page breaks, page numbers, report generation timestamp, and company branding if applicable

postconditions: Two files (CSV and PDF) are saved in the downloads folder
Both exported files contain accurate and complete report data
Original report remains displayed on screen
System logs the export activities
Files are ready for sharing or archival purposes

testCases.title: Ensure scheduled report delivery
preconditions: Manager user is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has access to the reporting module with scheduling capabilities
Manager has a valid email address configured in their user profile
Email delivery service is configured and operational
SMTP settings are properly configured in the system
At least one report configuration exists or can be created

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module and generate or select an approval workflow report
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with scheduling options available

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Schedule Report' button or link
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report configuration dialog or page opens

steps.action: Select 'Daily' from the frequency dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily frequency is selected and additional daily scheduling options appear

steps.action: Select the time for daily delivery (e.g., 8:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Selected time is displayed in the schedule configuration

steps.action: Verify the email address field is pre-populated with the manager's email
steps.expectedResult: Manager's email address from user profile is displayed in the recipient field

steps.action: Optionally add additional recipient email addresses if the feature allows
steps.expectedResult: Additional email addresses can be added and are displayed in the recipient list

steps.action: Select the report format for email delivery (CSV, PDF, or both)
steps.expectedResult: Selected format(s) are indicated in the schedule configuration

steps.action: Review the schedule summary showing frequency, time, recipients, and format
steps.expectedResult: Schedule summary displays all configured parameters correctly

steps.action: Click the 'Save Schedule' or 'Activate Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduled reports list or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Newly created schedule appears in the list with status 'Active' and shows next scheduled run time

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled time or trigger a test delivery if available
steps.expectedResult: System processes the scheduled report at the designated time

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox at or shortly after the scheduled delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Email is received with the subject line containing the report name and date

steps.action: Open the received email and verify the email body contains report summary or description
steps.expectedResult: Email body includes report details, date range, and any relevant summary information

steps.action: Verify the email contains the report attachment(s) in the specified format(s)
steps.expectedResult: Report file(s) are attached in the selected format (CSV and/or PDF) with appropriate filenames

steps.action: Download and open the attached report file(s)
steps.expectedResult: Attached files open successfully and contain accurate, up-to-date approval workflow data

steps.action: Return to the system and check the scheduled report execution log
steps.expectedResult: Execution log shows successful delivery with timestamp and recipient information

postconditions: Scheduled report is active and will continue to run daily at the specified time
Email delivery is logged in the system
Manager receives automated reports without manual intervention
Schedule can be modified or deactivated by the manager as needed
System maintains schedule configuration for future executions
